TopicTitle: How did I get so lucky? A sincere thanks.

Articles.Content: How was I so lucky that I am part of an amazing gaming community, connected to an amazing game, with wonderful and open developers. On top of that you are all the kindest, considerate, thoughtful group of gamers I've had the pleasure and joy of getting to know. Thank you guys.

Believe it or not, this game... the community and devs to be honest, saved me from commiting suicide through a very hard time of my life.

I owe my life to you guys.

In a way, I hate those sort of comments (not that I hear this everday). I mean, what the hell are you suposed to say to this? You're welcome? That sounds pritty damn stupid

Not ment offencive or anything, I'm glad you're still with us

Anyway, I agre to the OP. It's refreshing to see how troll-less (yes, that's a word now) this forum is, among other things

Edited December 13, 2013 by Sirrobert

I got lucky from watching Robbaz on YouTube. KSP really has been a great aid in keeping my mind sharp and has also changed my life. I am always thinking about life, the universe (or multiverse, or cosmos, if that works for you), and just how lucky we are to be here in this world, and the way things are. Good luck to all in life.

By the way Sirrobert, you might want to take that comment back. It could be offensive to some people. I have had personal problems in life (like many people), but those going through depression/anxiety really know what it is like.

Edited December 12, 2013 by Woopert

I think you misunderstood his comment. He said he does not really know how to respond because it is a big thing, not as an insult.

The game and the community is pretty awesome. It's just one of those things, where you don't feel you found it as much as it found you. More fate than luck.

It still ceases to amaze me how different the community is from much of the interwebs. Like when someone posts in the Gameplay Questions section why parachutes aren't working when landing on the Mun (yes - more than once!), and people respond sensibly and politely with useful help. Always gives me a chuckle and realisation of what a wonderful community this is.
